macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Decline on February 4, 2026
items.summary: The Dow Jones fell 0.3% to 49,240.99, Nasdaq dropped 1.4% to 23,255.19, and S&P 500 slid 0.8% to 6,917.81 amid tech and healthcare sector worries, profit-taking, and rising VIX to 18.00. Technology, communication services, and health care sectors led declines, while energy surged 3.3%.

items.title: S&P 500 Continues Downward Trend to 6915
items.summary: The US500 index fell 0.05% to 6915 on February 4 after a 1.12% drop to 6898 on February 3, reflecting ongoing market caution despite year-over-year gains of 14.25%. Trading volume rose above average with more decliners on S&P 500.

items.title: Market Sentiment Shifts on Strong US Jobs Data
items.summary: US non-farm payrolls increased significantly, sparking speculation of potential Fed interest rate hikes; equities showed mixed risk-on tone amid inflation concerns. Currency pairs reacted with EUR/USD at 1.0900 on German data and USD/JPY at 145.50 on Treasury yields.

items.title: Bank of England Holds Rates Amid Inflation Worries
items.summary: The BoE maintained interest rates, but signaled potential future hikes due to inflation, contributing to GBP/USD volatility near 1.2500. Overall sentiment mixed with slight risk-on shift but central bank policy concerns persisting.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Falls 13-14% in Early 2026, Testing Key Support Levels
items.summary: Bitcoin has declined approximately 13-14% so far in 2026, falling below the $70,000 support level that analysts consider critical. The drop has raised concerns about potential further downside, with some analysts warning of a possible decline to $56,000-$57,000 if support breaks.

items.title: Trump Coin Reaches $15 Billion Market Value Amid Memecoin Surge
items.summary: President Trump's memecoin has surged to a market value of $15 billion as Trump leverages the memecoin economy to energize supporters and monetize attention. This reflects a broader shift in crypto market energy toward memecoins and away from traditional tokens.

items.title: Stablecoin Volume Explodes in January 2026
items.summary: Stablecoin trading volume surged dramatically in the first month of 2026, signaling a shift toward digital assets that don't correlate with cryptocurrency price movements. This trend reflects growing interest in blockchain infrastructure independent of token valuations.

items.title: Trump Administration Signals Support for Crypto Market Structure Bill
items.summary: President Trump's administration has indicated strong support for passing a crypto market structure bill, with Coinbase's chief legal officer confirming the White House is fully engaged on crypto policy. This regulatory development could provide clarity for the industry.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: BullFrog AI Announces New Precision AI Capability for Pharma
items.summary: BullFrog AI revealed a forthcoming scenario-based decision engine for pharmaceutical portfolio strategy and clinical trial design, set to launch March 25, enhancing their bfPREP and bfLEAP platforms with robust AI recommendations.[1]

items.title: Apple Integrates AI Agents into Xcode
items.summary: Apple has embedded AI agents into Xcode, marking a significant advancement in developer tools.[6]

items.title: OpenAI Reshuffles Safety Leadership
items.summary: OpenAI has restructured its safety leadership amid ongoing developments in AI governance.[6]

items.title: Intel Enters GPU Arms Race
items.summary: Intel is jumping into the GPU market to compete in AI hardware, boosting its position in high-performance computing.[6]

items.title: Rise of AI Agents Trend Emerges
items.summary: Analysis of recent news highlights the rise of AI agents orchestrating work and play, with implications for manufacturing, healthcare, and more, based on 700 articles.[3]

items.title: Web Summit Qatar: AI and Robotics Startups Raise $205M
items.summary: Startups at Web Summit Qatar secured $205M in funding, with AI and machine learning leading at $125M, underscoring investor focus on AI and robotics innovations.[7]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Project Genie Causes Major Stock Market Decline for Gaming Companies
items.summary: Google's Project Genie AI tool, which generates playable worlds from simple prompts, has triggered significant stock market losses among video game companies. Unity's shares fell 35% in a single day, while Nintendo, CD Projekt, and Take-Two also experienced declines, sparking industry debate about AI's impact on game developers.

items.title: Take-Two President Defends Creative Process Against AI World Builders
items.summary: Take-Two Interactive's president stated that Google's Project Genie 'is not a game engine' and cannot replace the creative process in game development, emphasizing that many elements beyond world creation are essential to making games.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass February 2026 Lineup Announced
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass is adding several notable titles in February 2026, including Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, Avowed, and Starsand Island, continuing the service's focus on genre diversity.

items.title: Sony Patents AI System for Personalized Gamer Podcasts
items.summary: Sony has patented a new AI system designed to generate unique, personalized podcasts of gaming news targeted at gamers, utilizing recognizable character voices.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: KKR and Singtel Consortium Acquires STT GDC for $5.2 Billion
items.summary: A consortium led by KKR and Singtel has agreed to buy STT GDC, a major data center provider, in a $5.2 billion deal. This acquisition highlights ongoing consolidation in the data center infrastructure sector amid rising demand.

items.title: EU Proposes Critical Minerals Partnership with US to Counter China
items.summary: The European Union plans to offer the United States a partnership on critical minerals to reduce dependence on China. This move aims to secure supply chains for essential tech manufacturing materials.

items.title: Supermicro Shares Surge 11% on Strong Server Sales Demand
items.summary: Supermicro Computer's stock rose 11% in premarket trading due to robust sales of servers used in data centers. The company benefits from continued infrastructure buildout despite broader tech sector pressures.
